storyInfo: Courier runs into a dilemma as he tackles Kjerag's logistics issues. SilverAsh appears before him.

attributes.content: Courier has a thick stack of paper in his hands as he stands by the shredder. The first page says 'Kjerag Logistics System Proposal'.
He wears a heavy, hesitant expression on his face, but eventually extends the proposal toward the shredder.
Wait.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Mr. Bison...
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Why are you destroying the proposal?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Because it failed.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I'm your logistics lecturer. You're not the one who decides what's failed.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Besides, you didn't have that look on your face when you first told me you were drafting a proposal for Kjerag's logistics system.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: May I have a look?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Pretty comprehensive.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: You've covered all the bases, from manpower to cost to transportation method to storage.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: It's a solid proposal.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: There's only one problem left to solve—the engineering issues in Terra Nullius.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: A Terra Nullius exists between the zone of actual Kjerag control and our neighboring countries.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: A full-fledged logistics system requires a more developed transportation infrastructure, but neighboring countries will not simply sit and watch as Kjerag develops Terra Nullius.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I could not find a way to solve this problem, so I decided to give up.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: If I recall correctly, I've discussed solutions to similar issues.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: One way is to invest in an international logistics company.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: In that case, there's no need to write a proposal at all—just leave it to a developed international logistics firm, like MountainDash Logistics.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: We discussed this too.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: In order to effectively operate in Kjerag, MountainDash would need someone reliable to manage local operations—someone like you.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: But you refused. Do you regret that choice?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Well—no.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Another way is to leave Kjerag and establish my own logistics firm.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: As clear as such a firm's Kjerag links would be, it would face a lot less opposition, as long as it does not belong to Kjerag officially.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I'm clear on that much, but—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You're not willing to accept it.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Just like you turned down my offer.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Because either way means leaving Karlan Trade, perhaps even leaving Kjerag.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: It's the thought of leaving Kjerag that you really want to banish, isn't it?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I realized that everything in this proposal was written with the assumption that I would manage it personally.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The proposal was custom-made for myself. Implementing it means I'm the one who would need to leave Kjerag.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I was too arrogant.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: So you're just giving up on the proposal?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I'll write a new one for the Master, so that he may find the right man.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: So you're just giving up on the opportunity?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I know how much Kjerag means to you.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: But this is a chance for you to show your value, isn't it?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: If you're not interested—
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Why did you choose to study at Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Thank you for the kind words, but my mind is made up.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Courier snatches the proposal from Bison before he can react.
Before he can put the proposal in the shredder, however, he hears a crowing from behind him.
The fowlbeast is even faster than he, and whisks the proposal away in its beak. He is familiar with this fowlbeast—Tenzin.
...Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Your thoughts seem have been heading down a dangerous path lately.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I... I'm sorry, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But I'm also curious. Let's have you implement the proposal, Weiss.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Mapping, route planning, negotiating with the villages, deploying personnel...
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Once you actually put things in place, you may find that they don't require your presence as much as you assumed they would.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Yes, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I'll go with you.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You have an avalanche warning team, don't you?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Just treat me as one of them.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Let me see up close whether you really can do what you think you can.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Yes, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Are you sure about this, Mr. SilverAsh?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I am.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: It's high time Weiss took a good look at himself.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: *Huff*... *huff*...
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Here, take my hand, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: No need. What of the others?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: They're already at the summit.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: This trail may be a little difficult for you, sir.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You're just trying to get rid of me, aren't you, Weiss?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But one who spends his time in an office doing paperwork is bound to be less active than those of us who spend most of our time outdoors, no?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: We can take a break here.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The team at the summit can wait a while. They'll understand.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: We can't delay the surveying on my account.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You're right, it has been a long time since I last climbed a hill.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You used to be very good at it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I took after my mother.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Not so much these days.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You are still very much like her. You've just learned to hide it better.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: By the way, I never told you this, but the day I took you in, I was only out there because my sisters made me go hunting with them.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I knew.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Did you?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Your sisters are not as tight-lipped as you are.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: By chance, they had you join them on a hunting trip in the mountains that day. By chance, you got separated from them. By chance, you ran into me.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It was snowing heavily that day. You were lost too, weren't you?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You put on a brave face, told me to come with you, and took me to the Silverash manor.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: When my grandparents came and begged the old master to take me on as a servant after I had lost my parents at a young age, it was you who persuaded him, saying that you wanted a male companion around your own age.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: And so, I became part of Clan Silverash.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Perhaps...
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Are your grandparents well?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Thanks to you, my grandfather is quite the man in Turicum's senior center, and my grandmother has opened a little shop of her own. They're rather enjoying their lives.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: To me, Matterhorn is a guardian, one who has always served my family. I almost take him for granted. You're different.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You, I took under my own wing—at least, that's what I thought at the time.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Besides, you were quick and nimble. For a while, I had you carry my messages to others, and their messages back to me.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: In truth, I was just trying to show you off.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: There's no need to feel guilty about it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It gave my life meaning.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: After all, I was a wild child who popped suddenly into the family. My presence was unwelcome to many.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: How can you be sure I did not use your name for my own designs in the process?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: If you did, you hid it well.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Heh. How very you.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Besides—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: At first, I did not enjoy running around the hills and mountains.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: With time, however, as I walked the forests and the mountain trails—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: As I climbed the snowy peaks—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: As I breathed the air atop the peaks, and watched the spectacle of the mountains in the distance against the blue sky—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I felt happy.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I began to enjoy it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Captain, Mast—SilverAsh. You're here.
attributes.name: Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Report.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: We have good news and bad news.
attributes.name: Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Start with the good news.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: This is the last location we're scheduled to visit on this survey trip. We've successfully plotted the Terra Nullius between Kjerag and our neighboring countries.
attributes.name: Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: We have also located all the independent villages in Terra Nullius.
attributes.name: Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: The experts have already plotted the most efficient and cost-effective route for transportation, assuming that the villages could be persuaded to act as hubs and depots.
attributes.name: Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: And the bad news?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The bad news is... although plans for the route are essentially in place, and costs as well as time required are largely within acceptable boundaries...
attributes.name: Scholar

attributes.content: Not all villages have accepted our proposal.
attributes.name: Scholar

attributes.content: That's also to be expected. Which ones are they?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Take a look.
attributes.name: Scholar

attributes.content: These few villages, especially this one.
attributes.name: Scholar

attributes.content: They are not friendly to outsiders. The village headman, at least, seems reasonable, but opposition from the others puts him in an awkward position.
attributes.name: Scholar

attributes.content: Wait, this village...
attributes.name: Courier
Courier
attributes.content: Pack it up.
Abandoning the plan?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I'm going back to Turicum.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The key to persuading those villagers lies there.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Just to make sure I understand this correctly, Mr. Weiss... you need to persuade the villagers in order to establish a logistics route.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: That's why you want me to write a letter to my father.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: The villagers hold your father in high-esteem, after all.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Of course, we're not going to force you, if you're not willing.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I've already told you the potential risks, and the benefits.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Of course I'm willing!
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: If not for your recommendation, I would never have come to Kjerag, and I wouldn't have found this job.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: Besides, it would be a dream come true if you really managed to establish such a route around Kjerag!
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: I'll get to it at once!
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: It's been a while since you've been home, hasn't it? If there's anything you want to send back to your family, I'll deliver it for you.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I-I couldn't trouble you with that.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: It's no trouble. These villages on the frontier rarely get supplies from Kjerag.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Besides, it would improve the chances of swaying your father.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: If you put it that way, I guess it would be rude to refuse.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: You know the staff at Turicum Station well.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: It's the main hub for all mail and cargo that goes through Kjerag.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I like it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Is that why you chose to study logistics at Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I enjoy running through the mountains.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I enjoy seeing the expressions on faces when messages, letters, and packages are delivered.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Be it your face, or any others.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Be it expressions of joy, pain, or sorrow.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Maybe it all began with a childhood whim of yours—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But I began to enjoy the feeling.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The feeling of linking people together.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Besides...
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: At first, I didn't understand why you wouldn't give me and Matterhorn specific duties at Karlan Trade.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: With time, however, I began to understand—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You wanted us to decide our own futures.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I never thought of myself as your master.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: That's why I never thought about determining your fates for you.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: But you never tell people what you think.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: On this trip, I kept pondering why you wanted to tag along.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It didn't seem like something worth your time and effort, whether you meant to urge me to stay, or urge me to go.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Now, I'm beginning to understand.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Tell me more.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Now is not the time, not yet.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Perhaps you've forgotten—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But we've been to this village that we're about to visit before, more than a decade ago.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Here's the letter, Mr. Weiss!
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: And this is the stuff to send to my folks.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: It might be a little too much. If you don't think it works—
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: It's fine. Give them to this man here.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Wait, isn't that Sir Enciodes—
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: No, he's a member of the Kjerag Expedition, of which I am the captain.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: ...I see. I remember it now.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I'll take it.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: H-Here you go, sir.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: Ugh... it's heavy.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: Have you forgotten me, Sage Edwards?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I am Weiss, captain of the Kjerag Expedition. This one here is Matterhorn, a warrior under my charge.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Ah, yes, I remember you.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: Come and greet the sage, Matterhorn.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It's been a while, sir.
attributes.name: Matterhorn?

attributes.content: Very good, very good.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: At first I thought you were hillmen coming from who-knows-where. Little could I imagine that you were heralds of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: How is that son of mine, Chris, doing in Kjerag?
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: We came to deliver Chris's letter, sir.
attributes.name: Matterhorn?

attributes.content: Along with the gifts he prepared for his family.
attributes.name: Matterhorn?

attributes.content: So many things? My goodness. He shouldn't have.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: (Softly) Whew—
attributes.name: Matterhorn?

attributes.content: (Whisper) Good work, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: (Whisper) Thanks.
attributes.name: Matterhorn?

attributes.content: Chris is doing very well in Kjerag. He is in line for a promotion to manager soon.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Please, go ahead and read the letter. It also explains why we're here.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I see. I know what you're here for.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: Let's go inside.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: May we count on you to convince the villagers, then?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It's no small business. There will be a lot to discuss.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: But don't worry. With Chris's letter and your guarantee, I'm sure they'll come around.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: Please feel free to let me know if our presence is warranted.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Very good, very good.
attributes.name: Old Villager

attributes.content: Do you remember now, Master?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Hard not to, after carrying so much all this way.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I wanted you to feel for yourself the importance of logistics.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Besides, I helped you carry half of it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: That day, I wanted to see what the outside was like, after my lessons.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: So I hopped on one of the downhill transport carts, and dragged you along with me.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I was scared out of my wits.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It was actually Matterhorn whom I wanted to bring first.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: But thinking again, I was sure he would try to stop me, so I turned to you.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: What made you so sure I wouldn't try to stop you?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You never stopped anyone from doing anything stupid, even me.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Besides, you wanted to see the outside too, didn't you?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I told you to turn back when we descended the mountain and saw nothing but a barren plain.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You just wouldn't listen.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: We were getting chewed out by Mother regardless. We might as well take a few more steps forward. Maybe there would be a surprise lying in wait for us.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: We would've starved to death if I didn't steal some food from the kitchen before we left.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I was cursing you under my breath all the way.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I thought you were grateful to me for saving your life.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: No one wants to starve in the wilderness.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Sure enough. I certainly don't.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: That's why I began to regret it when we ran out of food.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Fortunately, we found this village. Old Edwards was sweeping snow from his door. His hair wasn't white yet.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Do you remember how he almost chased us away because he thought we were hillmen?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I do.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You whipped up the name of some expedition out of nowhere and said you were the captain.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Somehow, he believed you, invited us into his home, and treated us to warm cystymilk.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: What were you thinking at the time?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: The old master had told me that there were people with ill-intent towards Clan Silverash. I thought it inadvisable to say the name of the family.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It's always the leader who has the target on his back, which was why I said I was the captain.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I thought it was a genius idea at the time. Now it seems so childish.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It's alright. I thought it was a genius idea at the time too.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Otherwise, I wouldn't have claimed to be the bravest warrior under your banner.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Courier falls silent for some reason.
He turns to look in the direction of Kjerag.
When we got back, Madam punished us by making us eat outside.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: That was the harshest punishment Mother ever gave me.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I still remember the tears in her eyes—
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: 'If you want to be out in the ice and snow so much, you might as well eat in it!'
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: That was it.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It was Lady Enya who delivered our meals the first day, then Lady Ensia the second day.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: On day three, the old master came out to eat with us together.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: In the end, Madam let us back in.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Mother always treated you as her son, and I treated you as my brother.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: And I know why you've come along.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You wanted to tell me that you'll never forget the ties that bind me and the Silverashes.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: And you wanted to hear the answer from my heart, directly.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: What's your answer?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: My answer is—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: That proposal was not the product of my arrogance.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It's something that only I can do.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Therefore...
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I request a leave of absence from Kjerag, Master.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The company registration office is just ahead.
Courier clutches the documents in his hand tightly and gulps.
You look just like I did when I was brooding over whether to knock on the door of House Caster.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Were you afraid, at the time?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Afraid? I was excited, excited for the surprises that might lie behind the door.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I've done many bold things, and I believe there are many ways in which I can serve you.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: But leaving Kjerag was the one thing that I never thought I would do.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I used to believe it was out of loyalty.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: People say I'm lucky to have loyal lieutenants like Weiss and Matterhorn.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: They don't realize I have no interest in blind loyalty, and it's not your loyalty that makes me trust you.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: We happen to be of similar minds, and I happen to not have strayed from the path yet. That's all there is to it, isn't it?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: The Weiss I know isn't just a kind and gentle soul.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: He watches everything and keeps it to himself. People believe he doesn't think for himself. Little do they know that he has long found the answer.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Do you know my answer?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: All I know that we're still of similar minds on the matter.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You and I both know that I'm the only man for the job.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I just wasn't sure if I'm ready to take this step.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You went to all the effort, coming on this trip with me, just to tell me—
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You know, and you remember.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You came to see me off, didn't you?
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I was waiting for the most nimble Itra in the mountains to muster the courage to descend into the vast unknown.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You will lose your most loyal lieutenant.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I will gain a new friend, an interesting ally, a worthy competitor.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Master. I expect this is the last time I'll call you that. I'll leave your side and leave Clan Silverash.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I'll establish my own logistics company.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: It will not be registered in Kjerag. It will focus on the development of routes in the Terra Nullius surrounding Kjerag, in conjunction with MountainDash Logistics.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Its operations will not be limited to logistics. It will participate in the development of villages in Terra Nullius, and improve the state of transportation around Kjerag.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Perhaps it will even build a new nomadic city on the outskirts of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: Will it be Karlan Trade's ally, or enemy?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I can only promise that it will remain a friend to Kjerag. It was you who taught me that there is no such thing as an absolute ally or enemy in the realm of business.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: You think you can persuade Bison to work with you?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: Between a worthwhile partner and a subordinate whose loyalty is uncertain, he knows which choice to make.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: My name won't carry much weight outside Kjerag.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: The things I've learned over the years by your side and from Rhodes Island will last me a while.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I'm never going to hear the end of it from Ensia about how I keep driving people away.
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: You'll deserve it. Of course, Silverash Manor is still my home, and I could hardly be faulted for coming home once in a while.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: What should we call this company, this new friend of Kjerag?
attributes.name: SilverAsh

attributes.content: I think 'Courier Logistics' will do nicely.
attributes.name: Courier
